text: Gloire Amanda (born November 11, 1998) is a Canadian soccer player who plays college soccer for the Oregon State Beavers men's soccer program. ==Career== === Whitecaps FC 2=== Amanda signed his first professional contract with Whitecaps FC 2 on March 31, 2017, having been with the Whitecaps academy since he was 15.https://www.whitecapsfc.com/post/2017/03/31/gloire-amanda-signs-pro- contract-residency- wfc2https://www.independentsportsnews.com/2017/03/31/whitecaps-fc-sign- residency-striker-gloire-amanda-usl-contract/ In May 2017, Amanda was named to the Whitecaps roster for the 2017 Canadian Championship on a short term contract. He would spend one season with Whitecaps FC 2 before the club ceased operations after the 2017 season. Rather than sign a USL deal with the Whitecaps new affiliate, Fresno FC, Amanda would elect to evaluate playing opportunities in college. ===Lane United FC=== While playing for Oregon State, Amanda would sign with Lane United FC of the Premier Development League for the 2018 season. == Personal == Amanda was born in the Nyarugusu refugee camp, before his family moved to Edmonton, Alberta, Canada when he was 8 years old.https://www.independentsportsnews.com/2017/03/31/whitecaps-fc-sign- residency-striker-gloire-amanda-usl-contract/ His younger brother, Prince, is also a professional soccer player currently with FC Edmonton. ==References== ==External links== *Whitecaps bio * Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Association football forwards Category:Canadian soccer players Category:Oregon State Beavers men's soccer players Category:Whitecaps FC 2 players Category:Soccer people from Alberta Category:Sportspeople from Edmonton Category:USL Championship players Category:Lane United FC players Category:USL League Two players Category:Canadian expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Canadian expatriate soccer players Category:Expatriate soccer players in the United States
title: Gloire Amanda
